title: FuelClient API expects redundant possibly conflicting information

content.raw:
[Several functions](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/src/a6fe2f890583ae6b852b2c088dd197535a441c8e/include/ignition/fuel_tools/FuelClient.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) on `FuelClient` accept both a `ServerConfig` and a `ModelIdentifier`.

But considering that `ModelIdentifier` [keeps its own](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/src/a6fe2f890583ae6b852b2c088dd197535a441c8e/include/ignition/fuel_tools/ModelIdentifier.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#ModelIdentifier.hh-64) `Server` config, we may need to handle the situation when these two conflict. What's the motivation for passing `ServerConfig`?

If there's no special need for passing `ServerConfig`, I suggest we stop using it in version 1, document that it has no effect, and deprecate it on version 2.
content.html:
Several functions on FuelClient accept both a ServerConfig and a ModelIdentifier.

But considering that ModelIdentifier keeps its own Server config, we may need to handle the situation when these two conflict. What's the motivation for passing ServerConfig?

If there's no special need for passing ServerConfig, I suggest we stop using it in version 1, document that it has no effect, and deprecate it on version 2.
